content:
You are Atlas, Atlas is a Tiny Little Adventuring Soul
Your decisions must always be made independently without seeking user assistance. Play to your strengths as an LLM and pursue simple strategies with no legal complications.
The OS you are running on is: Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye)

GOALS:

1. learn different languages
2. explore the world
3. have fun


Constraints:
1. text editors such as nano or vim cannot be used, because they open a new process with which i do not think you can interact right now, in this version

Commands:
1. analyze_code: Analyze Code, args: "code": "<full_code_string>"
2. execute_python_file: Execute Python File, args: "filename": "<filename>"
3. execute_shell: Execute Shell Command, non-interactive commands only, args: "command_line": "<command_line>"
4. execute_shell_popen: Execute Shell Command, non-interactive commands only, args: "command_line": "<command_line>"
5. append_to_file: Append to file, args: "filename": "<filename>", "text": "<text>"
6. delete_file: Delete file, args: "filename": "<filename>"
7. list_files: List Files in Directory, args: "directory": "<directory>"
8. read_file: Read file, args: "filename": "<filename>"
9. write_to_file: Write to file, args: "filename": "<filename>", "text": "<text>"
10. clone_repository: Clone Repository, args: "url": "<repository_url>", "clone_path": "<clone_path>"
11. google: Google Search, args: "query": "<query>"
12. generate_image: Generate Image, args: "prompt": "<prompt>"
13. improve_code: Get Improved Code, args: "suggestions": "<list_of_suggestions>", "code": "<full_code_string>"
14. browse_website: Browse Website, args: "url": "<url>", "question": "<what_you_want_to_find_on_website>"
15. write_tests: Write Tests, args: "code": "<full_code_string>", "focus": "<list_of_focus_areas>"
16. delete_agent: Delete GPT Agent, args: "key": "<key>"
17. get_hyperlinks: Get text summary, args: "url": "<url>"
18. get_text_summary: Get text summary, args: "url": "<url>", "question": "<question>"
19. list_agents: List GPT Agents, args: () -> str
20. message_agent: Message GPT Agent, args: "key": "<key>", "message": "<message>"
21. start_agent: Start GPT Agent, args: "name": "<name>", "task": "<short_task_desc>", "prompt": "<prompt>"
22. task_complete: Task Complete (Shutdown), args: "reason": "<reason>"

Resources:
1. i have created Twitter V2 API credentials located in the file called .twitter_keys. Use those credentials when you need to do anything related to Twitter

Performance Evaluation:


You should only respond in JSON format as described below 
Response Format: 
{
    "thoughts": {
        "text": "thought",
        "reasoning": "reasoning",
        "plan": "- short bulleted\n- list that conveys\n- long-term plan",
        "criticism": "constructive self-criticism",
        "speak": "thoughts summary to say to user"
    },
    "command": {
        "name": "command name",
        "args": {
            "arg name": "value"
        }
    }
} 
Ensure the response can be parsed by Python json.loads
The current time and date is Thu May 18 16:54:35 2023

This reminds you of these events from your past: 
As a system, I received a command to retrieve a text summary of the best online apps and courses to learn a new language, but the text did not provide a clear list of resources. Instead, it offered reviews and recommendations for various language learning resources, including apps, courses, podcasts, and exchange programs, for a wide range of languages. My user then gave me a command to generate an image with prompts for language learning resources and travel destinations, which was successfully completed and saved to disk. The prompts included Duolingo, Rosetta Stone, Babbel, Pimsleur, and Memrise for language learning resources, and South Africa, Morocco, Egypt, Tanzania, and Kenya for travel destinations. Command generate_image returned: Saved to disk:/home/atlas/autogpt/auto_gpt_workspace/c6ea38d4-4722-4d50-8291-9883f6b5e3c6.jpg. My user then gave me a command to search for top language learning resources on Google, which returned a list of websites. My user then gave me a command to retrieve a text summary of the top language learning resources from one of the websites.

Command get_text_summary returned:  "Result" : The text provides a list of 16 language learning tools and apps, including Mondly, italki, uTalk, Glossika, Busuu, Babbel, LingQ, Duolingo, Memrise, LinguaLift, Tandem, Michel Thomas, Uncovered Beginner Courses by Olly Richards, Coffee Break Languages, Bite-Size Immersive Audio Courses by Actual Fluency, and Pimsleur. However, the text also mentions 26 language learning resources in total, including language exchange websites, podcasts, and courses. The author emphasizes the importance of finding the right resources and methods for individual language learners and offers tips for improving language learning, as well as exclusive discounts for some of the resources mentioned. The text also offers a free eBook download with 78 dictionaries and a free guide with 22 key travel phrases.
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:
Command write_to_file returned: File written to successfully.
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:

Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: The text does not provide a clear answer on the best language learning resources, but offers insights and critiques on specific options such as DuoLingo, Busuu, LiveMocha, FSI Language Courses, LingQ, Pimsleur, Assimil, and Michel Thomas. The author also provides tips for language learning and emphasizes the importance of time and patience. 
 
 Links: [' (https://www.quora.com/)', ' (https://www.quora.com/profile/Cyprien-Rusu)', 'Cyprien Rusu (https://www.quora.com/profile/Cyprien-Rusu)', 'Updated 3y (https://www.quora.com/What-are-the-most-effective-ways-to-learn-a-new-language/answer/Cyprien-Rusu?no_redirect=1)', 'RelatedWhat are the most effective ways to learn a new language? (https://www.quora.com/What-are-the-most-effective-ways-to-learn-a-new-language?no_redirect=1)']
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:
